    • Method Detail

      • isSupportedLTLFormula

        public static boolean isSupportedLTLFormula(ModelType modelType,
                                            Expression expr)
                                     throws PrismLangException
        Returns true if expression expr is a formula that can be handled by LTLModelChecker for the given ModelType.
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • checkMaximalStateFormulas

        public Expression checkMaximalStateFormulas(StateModelChecker mc,
                                            Model model,
                                            Expression expr,
                                            java.util.Vector<java.util.BitSet> labelBS)
                                     throws PrismException
        Extract maximal state formula from an LTL path formula, model check them (with passed in model checker) and replace them with ExpressionLabel objects L0, L1, etc. Expression passed in is modified directly, but the result is also returned. As an optimisation, expressions that results in true/false for all states are converted to an actual true/false, and duplicate results (or their negations) reuse the same label. BitSets giving the states which satisfy each label are put into the vector labelBS, which should be empty when this function is called.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • extractMaximalStateFormulas

        public Expression extractMaximalStateFormulas(Expression expr,
                                              java.util.List<Expression> labelExprs)
                                       throws PrismException
        Extract maximal state formula from an LTL path formula and replace them with ExpressionLabel objects L0, L1, etc. The expression passed in is modified directly, but the result is also returned. Duplicate maximal state formulae (or their negations) reuse the same label. The maximal state formula expressions are put into the list labelExprs, which should be empty when this function is called.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • constructDAForLTLFormula

        public DA<java.util.BitSet,? extends AcceptanceOmega> constructDAForLTLFormula(ProbModelChecker mc,
                                                                               Model model,
                                                                               Expression expr,
                                                                               java.util.Vector<java.util.BitSet> labelBS,
                                                                               AcceptanceType... allowedAcceptance)
                                                                        throws PrismException
        Construct a deterministic automaton (DA) for an LTL formula, having first extracted maximal state formulas and model checked them with the passed in model checker. The maximal state formulas are assigned labels (L0, L1, etc.) which become the atomic propositions in the resulting DA. BitSets giving the states which satisfy each label are put into the vector labelBS, which should be empty when this function is called.
        Parameters:
        mc - a ProbModelChecker, used for checking maximal state formulas
        model - the model
        expr - a path expression, i.e. the LTL formula
        labelBS - empty vector to be filled with BitSets for subformulas
        allowedAcceptance - the allowed acceptance types
        Returns:
        the DA
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • constructDFAForCosafetyRewardLTL

        public DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceReach> constructDFAForCosafetyRewardLTL(StateModelChecker mc,
                                                                             Model model,
                                                                             Expression expr,
                                                                             java.util.Vector<java.util.BitSet> labelBS)
                                                                      throws PrismException
        Constructs a deterministic finite automaton (DFA) for the given syntactically co-safe LTL formula, for use in reward computations for co-safe LTL.
        First, extracted maximal state formulas are model checked with the passed in model checker. The maximal state formulas are assigned labels (L0, L1, etc.) which become the atomic propositions in the resulting DA. BitSets giving the states which satisfy each label are put into the vector labelBS, which should be empty when this function is called.
        To achieve "strong" semantics for the next-step operator, an additional atomic proposition is added and X phi is transformed to X (phi & fresh_ap). This ensures that, e.g., X X true results in two steps of accumulation.
        Parameters:
        mc - the underlying model checker (for recursively handling maximal state formulas)
        model - the model
        expr - the co-safe LTL formula
        labelBS - empty vector to be filled with BitSets for subformulas
        Returns:
        a DA with AcceptanceReach acceptance condition
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • constructExpressionDAForLTLFormula

        public DA<java.util.BitSet,? extends AcceptanceOmega> constructExpressionDAForLTLFormula(Expression expr,
                                                                                         java.util.List<Expression> labelExprs,
                                                                                         AcceptanceType... allowedAcceptance)
                                                                                  throws PrismException
        Construct a deterministic automaton (DA) for an LTL formula, having first extracted maximal state formulas. The maximal state formulas are assigned labels (L0, L1, etc.) which become the atomic propositions in the resulting DA. Expressions for each label are put into the list labelExprs, which should be empty when this function is called.
        Parameters:
        expr - a path expression, i.e. the LTL formula
        labelExprs - empty list to be filled with Expressions for subformulas
        allowedAcceptance - the allowed acceptance types
        Returns:
        the DA
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • constructProductMC

        public LTLModelChecker.LTLProduct<DTMC> constructProductMC(ProbModelChecker mc,
                                                           DTMC model,
                                                           Expression expr,
                                                           java.util.BitSet statesOfInterest,
                                                           AcceptanceType... allowedAcceptance)
                                                    throws PrismException
        Generate a deterministic automaton for the given LTL formula and construct the product of this automaton with a Markov chain.
        Parameters:
        mc - a ProbModelChecker, used for checking maximal state formulas
        model - the model
        expr - a path expression
        statesOfInterest - the set of states for which values should be calculated (null = all states)
        allowedAcceptance - the allowed acceptance types
        Returns:
        the product with the DA
        Throws:
        PrismException

        public <M extends Model> LTLModelChecker.LTLProduct<M> constructProductModel(DA<java.util.BitSet,? extends AcceptanceOmega> da,
                                                                             M model,
                                                                             java.util.Vector<java.util.BitSet> labelBS,

                                                                      throws PrismException
        Construct the product of a DA and a model.
        Parameters:
        da - The DA
        model - The model
        labelBS - BitSets giving the set of states for each AP in the DA
